medical_history.chief_complaint: Fear of choking and inability to breathe, particularly while swallowing food.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, Ms. B, experienced a panic attack while eating several months prior to admission, which triggered a persistent fear of choking. Since the panic attack, she has been unable to eat solids and has lost 26 lbs (weighting 74 lbs at admission).
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of agoraphobia, some fears about swallowing and choking; previously refused medications except diazepam due to fears. Denied family history of formal psychiatric illness, except for an alcoholic father.
medical_history.family_history: Father was an alcoholic; no other family psychiatric history mentioned.
